TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/TreeView/Item extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of a tree view item. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.TreeView.Item class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of a tree view item.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.TreeView.Item.Disabled%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementTreeViewItem4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#318](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_113_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#318](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_113_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a tree view item in the disabled state.
Docs.value: A that represents a tree view item in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementTreeViewItem4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#318](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.v_128_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#318](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.v_128_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a tree view item in the normal state.
Docs.value: A that represents a tree view item in the normal state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a tree view item that is in the selected state but does not have focus.

remarks.format:
